events.name: GDGKL Android Coffee Meetup

group.name: Google Developer Group Kuala Lumpur - GDGKL

events.description:
It's been a while since our last casual meetup! Come and have a cuppa with us and we'll discuss and share everything about Android! 

Do bring your proudest Android projects to share and show them off to us! (read: getting it picked apart by Android experts) :)

UPDATE:

Thanks to the support of JetBrains (makers of the amazing IDE IntelliJ). We will have one FREE Jetbrains product to be raffled out to one of our lucky participants in this meetup!

events.name: Google IO Extended 2017 Kuala Lumpur

group.name: Google Developer Group Kuala Lumpur - GDGKL

events.description:
Google IO Extended Kuala Lumpur will once again happen on the 22nd of July 2017! We will be inviting speakers that are consists of local experts and Googlers to come and share about the experience in using Google technologies and best practices to propel your journey forward as a developer.

Don't miss your chance to learn more about the latest and greatest Google technologies and 1337 Dev skills from the dev experts! Seats will be limited, sign up now!

Website: https://ioxkl17.firebaseapp.com/

Note:

1. GDGKL will send emails for attendees to confirm their attendance a few days before the event. The tickets belong to attendees who did not confirm their ticket via email will be forfeited.

2. Walk-ins are strictly not allowed

3. Please get your ticket via http://ioxkl2017.peatix.com/

events.name: GDG Kuala Lumpur Web Meetup

venue.name: iTrain
venue.address_1: C-L19-08, Trillion KL No 338 Jalan Tun Razak 50400 Kuala Lumpur

group.name: Google Developer Group Kuala Lumpur - GDGKL

events.description:
GDGKL August meetup will be held at iTrain Kuala Lumpur on the 19th August 2017.

There will be a sharing on Progressive Web Apps and Polymer by Henry Lim and Sam Carecho.

During the meetup, you will learn how you can use web components and Polymer to build an awesome web app. Also, you will learn all the sweetest features you can get from Progressive Web Apps.

See you there!

Agenda

1:00 - Registration/Network

2:00 - Talk (Make The Web Great Again with Progressive Web Apps and Polymer) - Henry Lim

2:30 - Workshop (Building a PWA w/ Polymer) - Sam Careho

4:00 - END

IMPORTANT

Please fill up the form in order to gain entry to the venue.

https://goo.gl/forms/VVHJAQu890xY3f9q1

REMINDER

- Please bring your own devices as we will having a workshop.
- Please install the following tools:
  - Node.js ver 6.0.0 or greater (https://nodejs.org/en/­)
  - A recent version of Git
  - Polymer CLI (https://www.polymer-project.org/...­)
events.how_to_find_us: KL Trillion, 338 Jalan Tun Razak, Kuala Lumpur, 50450 Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

events.name: GDGKL Firebase October Meetup

venue.name: iTrain
venue.address_1: C-L19-08, Trillion KL No 338 Jalan Tun Razak 50400 Kuala Lumpur

group.name: Google Developer Group Kuala Lumpur - GDGKL

events.description:
GDGKL Firebase meetup will be held at iTrain Kuala Lumpur on the 7th October 2017 to prepare members for the upcoming Google Firebase Appfest Hackathon Malaysia.

Toru Wonyoung Choi is going to conduct a Firebase Android Codelab. This will be a hands-on session, so please come with Android Studio installed. 

AGENDA

2:00 - Talk (Introduction to Firebase, What's new in Firebase Cloud Firestore and All about Google Firebase Appfest Hackathon) - Henry Lim

2.30 - Codelab (Firebase Android Codelab) - Toru Wonyoung Choi

5:00 - END

IMPORTANT

Please fill up the form in order to gain entry to the venue.

https://goo.gl/forms/8bUKlLt7IlAZQAwn2

REMINDER

- Please bring your own devices as we will having a workshop. 

- Please install the following tools: 

- Android Studio version 2.1+.

- Google app version 6.6+ (only needed for testing Firebase App Indexing in Step 9)

events.name: GDGKL February 14 Android Meetup (aka Together Alone Meetup)

venue.name: Mindvalley Hall of Awesomeness
venue.address_1: Mindvalley. 29th Floor, Tower A, Menara UOA Bangsar, 5, Jalan Bangsar Utama 1, Kuala Lumpur, Kuala Lumpur

group.name: Google Developer Group Kuala Lumpur - GDGKL

events.description:
• What we'll do
Happy 2018! It's like promising ourselves to go to the gym in our New Year's Resolution. We might know what is unit testing, we might know what's a TDD. But most of us will fail.

So to start off our first event of the year. We will have a workshop on the basics of the basics, Android Unit and instrumental testing.

• What to bring
Laptop with Android Studio and emulators installed, Jackets, Water, Yourself, Power plugs and extensions

• Important to know
If you are already pro in doing testing in Android, do come and help out! Contact JT for more information.

events.name: GDGKL April Meetup - Actions on Google & Puppeteer

venue.name: iTrain
venue.address_1: C-L19-08, Trillion KL No 338 Jalan Tun Razak 50400 Kuala Lumpur

group.name: Google Developer Group Kuala Lumpur - GDGKL

events.description:
GDGKL April Meetup will be held at iTrain Kuala Lumpur on the 14th April 2018.

In this meetup, we will focus on two Google technologies: Puppeteer & Actions on Google.

1. Talk + Demo on Puppeteer (60 min)
By Jecelyn Yeen

Puppeteer(https://github.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer) gives you the ability to control your browser programmatically. Jecelyn will share about 5+ things you can do with Puppeteer.

2. Talk + Codelab on Google Actions (120 min)
By Lim Shang Yi

How you can use actions on Google to create wide variety of apps. Learn how to create your own voice app with Actions on Google with Dialogflow and Firebase.

Setup before the session
1. Install Nodejs 8.11 and above https://nodejs.org/en/.
2. Install Firebase CLI by run this command in command prompt/terminal `npm install -g firebase-tools`.
3. You must have a Gmail account https://www.google.com/gmail.

• Speakers
- Jecelyn Yeen, Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies and Angular
- Lim Shang Yi, Google Developer Expert in Firebase

• What to bring
Laptop, Jackets, Water, Yourself, Power plugs and extensions

#buildactions #GoogleAssistant #Puppeteer #GDG #GDGKL

events.name: Women Techmakers Kuala Lumpur IWD 2018

group.name: Google Developer Group Kuala Lumpur - GDGKL

events.description:
Yes! It's that time again and for the 4th time running, Women Techmakers Kuala Lumpur (WTMKL) will be hosting the global series of International Women's Day (IWD) 2018 Celebration, here in Cyberjaya!

Expect a day full of brilliant speakers with a talk/session in which they share ideas that will inform, inspire and transform you, meeting and connecting with other amazing women just like you, an opportunity for you to just be yourself and surrounded with other smart and strong women! So what are you waiting for? Grab your tickets NOW!

Please register here: http://wtmkl18.peatix.com

Women Techmakers, powered by Google Developers Group Kuala Lumpur (GDGKL) are designed to promote an environment of inclusion for women in technology, as well as celebrate women leading the industry. We want to advance, grow, and celebrate women developers, designers, and technology entrepreneurs.

It doesn't really matter what you do. As long as you are in the industry, you should be a part of the Women Techmakers community! Join us!

For more information on Women Techmakers Kuala Lumpur, please feel free to find us at www.facebook.com/WomenTechmakersKL/

#wtmkl #womentechmakers #womentechmakerskl #iwd18 #womenintech

events.name: Introduction to Kotlin

group.name: Google Developer Group Kuala Lumpur - GDGKL

events.description:
Introduction to Kotlin (Workshop) will be held at MindValley Tech Office on the 9th June 2018.

• What we'll do
We'll have a tech talk then a workshop where you will learn the basics of Kotlin, create an Android app using it, and you will see why you should make the switch from Java to Kotlin.

• Agenda
- A brief history about Kotlin.
- Why it’s really cool? (Advantages)
- Configuring Kotlin in Android Studio.
- Simple Hello world program.
- Workshop & Quick discussion

• Speakers
- Amr Mohsen:
Amr is a certified Android facilitator by Google & Udacity, he has a +5 years Android developer, 3 years GSA and GDG advisor in the MENA region & 4 years as an Android instructor.

- Harsh Mittal:
Harsh mittal is a Creative Technocrat, Technology Enthusiast, Developer, Traveler, Mentor, Problem solver, Fitness Enthusiast with over 5 years of Development experience.

• What to bring
Laptop with Android Studio and emulators installed, Jackets, Water, Yourself, Power plugs and extensions

#Kotlin #Android #GDG #GDGKL

events.name: Data, ML, AI Study Jam

group.name: Google Developer Group Kuala Lumpur - GDGKL

events.description:
Get tickets and RSVP at: https://ml-study-jams.peatix.com/

Join us for a study jam session on Data, ML, AL, powered by Qwiklabs! Qwiklabs has step by step walkthoughs which guides you from start to finish. This study jam is a self paced, stress free and fun session on Data, ML, AI. We will also have facilitators to help you out with the material. You will have access to Qwiklab credits on the day itself.

Facilitators:
Tee Pei Yee, Web Developer, Maxima Technologies
Dara Tumenbayeva, Data Scientist, SEEK Asia
Qamra Jema Khan, Data Scientist, RHB Bank
Teh Kim Ming, Principal Data Scientist, Media Prima
Lim Shang Yi, Full Stack Developer, IdealHub

Ticket for Males is RM 10, and this is used to support your lunch and snacks!
Tickets for Females is FREE in conjunction with International Womens day!

Get tickets and RSVP at: https://ml-study-jams.peatix.com/

events.name: Women Techmakers Kuala Lumpur International Women's Day ( IWD ) Celebration

group.name: Google Developer Group Kuala Lumpur - GDGKL

events.description:
Women Techmakers Kuala Lumpur is proud to present our International Women's Day Celebration, happening Saturday March 30th 2019 at Google KL.
Whether you are a technical or non-technical woman in technology, there will be something for everyone at this event, as this is a celebration of women. For our non-technical stream, we have a special "I am Remarkable" workshop, a Google initiative empowering women and underrepresented groups to celebrate their achievements in the workplace and beyond! In the "Artificial Intelligence and Art" codelab, we will show you how to programmatically create art in the style of local female artists.

Agenda:

09:00am: Registration

09:30am :Keynote

10:00am : The WTM Scholar Experience
Fatima Tayeeb, WTM Scholar

10:15am -10:30am: Winning "Cyber Security Woman of 2019 for Asia Pacific"
Lina Maharon, IT Security Consultant (Lead Penetration Testing), Teleawan Sdh Bhd.

10:30 am: Augmented Reality (AR) in STEM education
Preedha AG, Sunway University

11:00am : Fireside Chat: Women In Technology Panel
Chen Wei Jia, Consumer Product Lead, Fave
Farah Fauzi, Community Manager, Techstars
Fariza Farish, Consulting Analyst for Technology, Accenture
Moderator: Jenny Lim, Women@Google

12:00pm -2:00pm: Lunch and Networking

2:00pm -3.30pm:
Technical Stream: Artificial Intelligence in ART Codelab
Qamra Jema Khan, Data Scientist, RHB Bank

3:30pm - 5:00pm Technical Stream: Build Actions For Google Assistant Codelab
Christine Tee, Founder of Maxima Technologies & Dara Tumenbayeva, Data Scientist, SEEK Asia

2:00pm - 3.30pm Non-Technical Stream: I am REMARKABLE Workshop
Miami A. Cabansay, Content Strategy Manager, gTech gUP Content

3:30pm - 5:00pm : Non Technical Stream: "Fundamentals of Presentation Skills"
TBD

5:00pm - 5:30pm
Closing remarks, photos, etc.

Women Techmakers Kuala Lumpur (WTMKL) is powered by Google Developers Group Kuala Lumpur (GDGKL) as is designed to promote an environment of inclusion for women in technology, as well as celebrate women leading the industry. We want to advance, grow, and celebrate women developers, designers, and technology entrepreneurs.

*****IMPORTANT****: RSVP for this event is now closed.
